reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Building Effective Health Systems for Malaria Control

description.narrative: Ghana - Malaria - Ministry of Health of the Republic of Ghana - Ghana Mal-MOH. This program has the following goals: Reduce the malaria mortality by 90% by the year 2025 (using 2019 as baseline). Reduce malaria case incidence by 50% by 2025 compared with 2019 baseline. Achieve malaria pre-elimination in at least 6 districts by 2025. Contribute to accelerating the achievement of national HIV,TB and Malaria targets by 2023. Strengthen and expand the capacity of Ghana's PHC system to contribute to the attainment of UHC by 2030. The objectives of this program are: Protect at least 90% of the population with effective malaria prevention interventions by 2025. Provide appropriate diagnosis to all suspected malaria cases and prompt and effective treatment to 100% of confirmed malaria cases in accordance to treatment guidelines by 2025. Ensure timely and adequate supply of quality-assured malaria commodities to all service delivery points by 2025. Increase awareness and knowledge of the entire population on malaria prevention and control so as to improve uptake and correct use of all interventions by 2025. Strengthen and maintain capacity for Governance and programme management to achieve programmatic objectives at all levels towards malaria control and pre-elimination by 2025. Strengthen malaria surveillance and M&E system to ensure timely availability of high quality, consistent malaria data at all levels including private sector, to track the progress of malaria interventions towards the 2025 malaria control targets. Improve finance and resource mobilization. Ensure timely availability and access to quality drugs and essential commodities for HIV, TB and Malaria from national level to primary health care delivery points (CHPS). Scale up and optimise HMIS solutions that will enhance health systems data flow to inform management decisions affecting HIV,TB and Malaria. Increase effective management and accountability of funds flow from all sources

title.narrative: GHA-M-MOH Progress Report
GHA-M-MOH Program Agreement 4
GHA-M-MOH Program Agreement 5
GHA-M-MOH Program Agreement
GHA-M-MOH Grant Performance Report
GHA-M-MOH Grant Performance Report
GHA-M-MOH Implementation Letter 1
GHA-M-MOH Implementation Letter 1
GHA-M-MOH Implementation Letter 2
GHA-M-MOH Implementation Letter 3
GHA-M-MOH Implementation Letter 4
GHA-M-MOH Implementation Letter 5
Impact indicator for GHA-M-MOH
Inpatient malaria deaths per year: rate per 100,000 persons per year
Confirmed malaria cases (microscopy or RDT): rate per 1000 persons per year
Malaria parasite prevalence: Proportion of children aged 6-59 months with malaria infection
Malaria test positivity rate
Under 5 mortality rate per 1000 live births
All-cause under-5 mortality rate per 1000 live births
Coverage / Output indicator for GHA-M-MOH
RSSH-Other 1: Transactions made through electronic means as a percentage of total payments processed by GHS
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to at-risk populations through mass campaigns
RSSH-Other 2: Advances remaining unaccounted for as a percentage of total advances made by GHS to RHDs in the period
Proportion of targeted risk groups receiving long-lasting insecticidal-nets
PSM-Other 2: Percentage of shipments cleared from customs to Central Medical Stores in 15 working days (or less)
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities
CM-other 3: Number of children under five years which received first-line antimalrial treatment according to national policy(ACTs) at the community level
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to targeted risk groups through continuous distribution
PSM-Other 4: Percentage of emergency orders issued during the reporting period
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities
PSM-Other 3: Percentage of standard orders (excluding emergency orders) with turn-around-time in 15 working days (or less)
CM-other 2: Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment according to national policy at health facilities
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment in the community
Timeliness of facility reporting: Percentage of submitted facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are received on time per the national guidelines
CM-other 1: Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at health facilities
Proportion of pregnant women attending antenatal clinics who received three or more doses of intermittent preventive treatment for malaria
Percentage of public financial management system components used for grant financial management
Percentage of children aged 3–59 months who received the full number of courses of SMC (3 or 4) per transmission season in the targeted areas
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
CM-other 4: Proportion of estimated malaria cases (presumed and confirmed) that received first line anti-malarial treatment at health facilities
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test in the community
Proportion of facility reports received over the reports expected during the reporting period
Proportion of population at risk potentially covered by long lasting insecticidal nets distributed
Outcome indicator for GHA-M-MOH
Proportion of households sprayed by IRS within the last 12 months

National aggregate HMIS fully deployed and functional: Percentage of HMIS components in place (HIS deployment, completeness, timeliness, and integration of aggregate disease reporting for HIV, TB and malaria indicators)
Proportion of population that slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of pregnant women who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net for every two people and/or sprayed by IRS within the last 12 months
Proportion of children under five years old who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of population with access to an ITN within their household
Percentage of health facilities with tracer medicines for the three diseases available on the day of the visit or day of reporting
Malaria O-other 2: Government expenditure on TB, HIV and Malaria as percentage of total government health expenditure
Malaria O-2b: Percentage under five years old with fever in the last two weeks who receive antimalarial treatment according to national policy within 24 hours of onset of fever
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net
Malaria O-other 1: Government expenditure on health as percentage of total government expenditure
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net for every two people
Proportion of population using an insecticide-treated net among those with access to an insecticide-treated net
Percentage of births attended by skilled health professional
Malaria O-1: Percentage of population in target areas protected with indoor residual spraying in the last 12 months.
Percentage of women attending antenatal care
